verses.translation: Nun. By the Pen and the (Record) which (men) write,-
Thou art not, by the Grace of thy Lord, mad or possessed.
Nay, verily for thee is a Reward unfailing:
And thou (standest) on an exalted standard of character.
Soon wilt thou see, and they will see,
Which of you is afflicted with madness.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.translation: Verily it is thy Lord that knoweth best, which (among men) hath strayed from His Path: and He knoweth best those who receive (true) Guidance.
verses.transliteration: Inna rabbaka huwa aAAlamu biman dallaAAan sabeelihi wahuwa aAAlamu bilmuhtadeen

verses.translation: So hearken not to those who deny (the Truth).
Their desire is that thou shouldst be pliant: so would they be pliant.
Heed not the type of despicable men,- ready with oaths,
A slanderer, going about with calumnies,
(Habitually) hindering (all) good, transgressing beyond bounds, deep in sin,
Violent (and cruel),- with all that, base-born,-
Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons.

verses.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: When to him are rehearsed Our Signs, "Tales of the ancients", he cries!
verses.transliteration: Itha tutla AAalayhi ayatunaqala asateeru al-awwaleen

verses.translation: Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout!

verses.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
verses.translation: Verily We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the morning.
verses.transliteration: Inna balawnahum kamabalawna as-haba aljannati ith aqsamoolayasrimunnaha musbiheen

verses.translation: But made no reservation, ("If it be Allah's Will").

verses.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
verses.translation: Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from thy Lord, (which swept away) all around, while they were asleep.
verses.transliteration: Fatafa AAalayha ta-ifunmin rabbika wahum na-imoon

verses.translation: So the (garden) became, by the morning, like a dark and desolate spot, (whose fruit had been gathered).
As the morning broke, they called out, one to another,-

verses.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
verses.translation: "Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning, if ye would gather the fruits."
verses.transliteration: Ani ighdoo AAala harthikum inkuntum sarimeen

verses.translation: So they departed, conversing in secret low tones, (saying)-

verses.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
verses.translation: "Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."
And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) resolve.
But when they saw the (garden), they said: "We have surely lost our way:
"Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"

verses.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
verses.translation: Said one of them, more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you, 'Why not glorify (Allah)?'"
verses.transliteration: Qala awsatuhum alam aqul lakumlawla tusabbihoon

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"
Then they turned, one against another, in reproach.
They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!

verses.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
verses.translation: "It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"
verses.transliteration: AAasa rabbuna an yubdilanakhayran minha inna ila rabbina raghiboon

verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter,- if only they knew!
verses.transliteration: Kathalika alAAathabu walaAAathabual-akhirati akbaru law kanoo yaAAlamoon

verses.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.translation: Verily, for the Righteous, are Gardens of Delight, in the Presence of their Lord.
Shall We then treat the People of Faith like the People of Sin?
What is the matter with you? How judge ye?
Or have ye a book through which ye learn-
That ye shall have, through it whatever ye choose?

verses.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
verses.translation: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?
verses.transliteration: Am lakum aymanun AAalayna balighatunila yawmi alqiyamati inna lakum lama tahkumoon

verses.translation: Ask thou of them, which of them will stand surety for that!

verses.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: Or have they some “ Partners ” (in Godhead)? Then let them produce Their “ partners ”,  If they are truthful !
verses.transliteration: Am lahum shurakao falya/too bishuraka-ihimin kanoo sadiqeen

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.translation: The Day that the shin shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration, but they shall not be able,-
verses.transliteration: Yawma yukshafu AAan saqin wayudAAawnaila assujoodi fala yastateeAAoon

verses.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
verses.translation: Their eyes will be cast down,- ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration, while they were whole, (and had refused).
verses.transliteration: KhashiAAatan absaruhumtarhaquhum thillatun waqad kanoo yudAAawna ilaassujoodi wahum salimoon

verses.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Then leave Me alone with such as reject this Message: by degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not.
verses.transliteration: Fatharnee waman yukaththibubihatha alhadeethi sanastadrijuhum min haythula yaAAlamoon

verses.translation: A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.

verses.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
verses.translation: Or is it that thou dost ask them for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-
verses.transliteration: Am tas-aluhum ajran fahum min maghraminmuthqaloon

verses.translation: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, so that they can write it down?

verses.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
verses.translation: So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish,- when he cried out in agony.
verses.transliteration: Fasbir lihukmi rabbikawala takun kasahibi alhooti ith nadawahuwa makthoom

verses.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
verses.translation: Had not Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been cast off on the naked shore, in disgrace.
verses.transliteration: Lawla an tadarakahu niAAmatunmin rabbihi lanubitha bilAAara-i wahuwa mathmoom

verses.translation: Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.

verses.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.translation: And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!"
verses.transliteration: Wa-in yakadu allatheenakafaroo layuzliqoonaka bi-absarihim lamma samiAAooaththikra wayaqooloona innahu lamajnoon

verses.translation: But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.
